links.*: The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)
The Lord of the Rings Symphony

wikitext.*:
<noinclude>{{month|September}}
Events that occurred on 18 September.
==On Earth==
</noinclude>
* '''[[1905]]''' - Author [[George MacDonald]] dies.
* '''[[1954]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes letters [[letter 150|150]] and [[letter 151|151]].
* '''[[1954]]''' - [[Naomi Mitchison]] published a review of ''[[The Fellowship of the Ring]]'' in the ''[[wikipedia:New Statesman|New Statesman]]''.
* '''[[1955]]''' - Voice actor [[Bob Papenbrook]] is born.
* '''[[1963]]''' - Writer [[Gary Russell]] is born.
* '''[[1967]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Elsie Honeybourne (18 September 1967)|a letter to Elsie Honeybourne]].
* '''[[1981]]''' - Extracts from [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s "[[The Name Coventry]]" is published in ''[[The Catholic Herald (18 September 1981)|The Catholic Herald]]''.
* '''[[1982]]''' - The tenth episode of the new version of the [[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|1981 radio series]] of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' is aired on [[BBC|BBC Radio 4]].
* '''[[1993]]''' - [[Oxonmoot 1993]] at [[wikipedia:University College, Oxford|University College]].
* '''[[1994]]''' - [[Oxonmoot 1994]] at [[wikipedia:University College, Oxford|University College]].
* '''[[2003]]''' - [[Oxonmoot 2003]] at [[wikipedia:St Hugh's College, Oxford|St Hugh's College]].
* '''[[2004]]''' - [[Oxonmoot 2004]] at [[wikipedia:St Hilda's College, Oxford|St Hilda's College]].
* '''[[2004]]''' - [[The Lord of the Rings Symphony]] at Mortensen Hall in [[wikipedia:Hartford, Connecticut|Hartford]], [[wikipedia:Connecticut|Connecticut]].
* '''[[2005]]''' - [[Oxonmoot 2005]] at [[wikipedia:St Peter's College, Oxford|St Peter's College]].
* '''[[2006]]''' - ''[[The Children of Húrin]]'' is announced.
* '''[[2020]]''' - [[Oxonmoot 2020]] held online due to the [[wikipedia:COVID-19 pandemic|Covid-19 pandemic]].

==In Arda==
* {{TA|3018}}: 
** [[Gwaihir]] rescues [[Gandalf]] from the pinnacle of [[Orthanc]] in the early hours.
** The [[Nazgûl|Black Riders]] cross the [[Fords of Isen]].
** The Black Riders visit [[Saruman]] who lies that Gandalf has "confessed", and gives them directions to [[the Shire]].<noinclude><ref>[[The Hunt for the Ring]], [http://www.marquette.edu/library/archives/Mss/JRRT/JRRT-seriesa4.shtml ''The Lord of the Rings'': Additional Manuscripts Presented by Christopher Tolkien, Fourth Installment (MSS-4/2/33)]</ref></noinclude>
** {{Cal Travel-Boromir}}
